title: What was the first computer and what was it used for? - Quora

response.answer_text: As stated by Mr. Bair, ENIAC was the first electronic (vacuum tube) programmable computer. Prior to ENIAC, there were mechanical computers, like the old adding machines, that were programmable, but not in the sense of the word we now use. I just watched a remarkable documentary about the (primarily) women that operated these machines. Its called “"The Computers” I can't recall if I saw this on Netflix or Amazon Video, and I never knew these women existed.

You didn’t specify what kind of “first computer” The very first computer was mechanical, it was developed in 1822 And the first programmable computer was mechanical too I will assume that you are asking about “The first digital, programmable and general purpose computer” It’s ABC..short for Atanasoff-Berry Computer The vast majority thought that ENIAC is the very first digital computer but it is not. ABC began development in 1937 while ENIAC began in 1943
